alert.note: Alert for Marion; Schley; Taylor (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 7:53PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Marion, northwestern Schley and south central Taylor Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 753 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Murrays Crossroads, or 9 miles north of Ellaville, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Putnam, Murrays Crossroads, Tazewell, Doyle and Walls Crossing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
